snippet: From ending mass incarceration to the decision to court donors for a “super PAC,” she appears ready to take stands that are unpopular with some voters or interest groups.
abstract: Political Memo; Hillary Clinton is evincing a new-found willingness to take risks and make unpopular stances in her bid for the 2016 presidential elections, marking contrast with reticence of her 2008 candidacy; scandals-be-damned attitude has included a strong stance against mass incarceration and a willingness to court super PAC donors.
lead_paragraph: From ending mass incarceration to the decision to court donors for a “super PAC,” she appears ready to take stands that are unpopular with some voters or interest groups.

headline.print_headline: A New Willingness to Assume the Risk
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Shows New Willingness to Tackle Risky Issues
